definition: to extract (ore or other resource from a mine)/to exploit/to mine

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to pick/to pluck/to collect/to select/to choose/to gather

sentences.english: He thinks that the 2 prospects well.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲此礦大有開採前途。

sentences.english: The technological key to leaching mining of underground polyhalite is the extraction of effective constitutes from polyhalite.
sentences.chinese: 溶浸開採雜滷石的技術關鍵在於其中有效成分的溶出。

sentences.english: Shoulder angle working face big mechanized mining captain Zhao-Bing told reporters.
sentences.chinese: 擔負大傾角工作面開採的綜採隊隊長孫兆冰告訴筆者。

sentences.english: The vapor boiler is the main equipment consume energy.
sentences.chinese: 熱採注汽鍋爐是稠油開採中的主要耗能設備。

sentences.english: In open-pit mines, the problem of underground mining under the slope is usually encountered.
sentences.chinese: 邊坡下方井工開採是一個露天煤礦普遍存在的問題。

sentences.english: As early as 6000 B. C. Dushan Jade has been mined.
sentences.chinese: 早在公元前6000年獨山玉就已經被開採。

sentences.english: Safety measure of mining under sea is introduced as well.
sentences.chinese: 並介紹了海下開採安全技術措施。

sentences.english: The salinity in seawater will increase when the sea ice are exploited and desalinated extensively.
sentences.chinese: 海冰的大規模開採和淡化會導致周圍水體的鹽分增加。

sentences.english: The large companies used huge machines to dig for gold.
sentences.chinese: 一些大公司利用大型的機器設備開採黃金。

sentences.english: Peopel still mine for coal in this area.
sentences.chinese: 人們還在這個地區開採煤礦。

sentences.english: The Fengfeng Five Mine is an old mine.
sentences.chinese: 峯局五礦是多年開採的老礦。

sentences.english: The road to the green world of the future starts from the black earth.
sentences.chinese: 從黑色的稀土開採駛向未來開始的綠色世界。

sentences.english: Collapse of stope roof, is one of disasters occuring at underground mines.
sentences.chinese: 礦山採場頂板冒落是地下礦山開採中常見的災害。

sentences.english: Into the 19th century those caverns and tunnels were mined for building stone.
sentences.chinese: 直到二十世紀，這些大礦洞和隧道還在開採建築石料。

sentences.english: Experienced diamond miners can tell a diamond immediately.
sentences.chinese: 有經驗的金剛石開採者以立即人辨出金剛石。

sentences.english: A coal mining in thin seam is an inevitable issue of coal mining in many coal mines.
sentences.chinese: 薄煤層開採是許多礦井煤炭開採中不可避免的問題。

definition: remaining quantity/reserves (of natural resources, oil etc)
to generate electricity/to send a telegram
to put into production/to put into operation
